intro: Leucosinapis hispida, commonly known as the hispid legume, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and trifoliate leaves, which are typical of many legumes. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemose inflorescences. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several elliptical seeds. Leucosinapis hispida is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it plays a role in soil stabilization and nitrogen fixation.
